sentences.en: All commercial nuclear power is provided by fission at the present time.
sentences.cn: 目前所有的商用核动力都是通过核裂变产生的.

sentences.en: Essentially, all the neutrons and part of the gamma rays are emitted in the actual fission process .
sentences.cn: 从根本上说，所有的中子和一部分射线都是在裂变实际的过程中放射出来的。

sentences.en: Fission bombs use highly enriched fuel.
sentences.cn: 裂变原子弹使用高度浓缩燃料.

sentences.en: How it causes the body's atomic structure to undergo fission.
sentences.cn: 它是如何导致人体原子结构分裂的?

sentences.en: Indirect ionization by neutrons can also result from fission of plutonium or uranium isotopes.
sentences.cn: 通过使钚或铀同位素裂变,中于也能产生间接的电离作用.

sentences.en: Niels Bohr and John Wheeler published a theory of the dynamic process of fission.
sentences.cn: 尼恩、波尔和惠勒以惊人的速度发表了裂变的动力过程的理论.

sentences.en: Nuclear fission is more promising, but nuclear fuel is also finite.
sentences.cn: 核裂变发电更有前途, 但核燃料也是有限的.

sentences.en: Nuclear fission would have been a dramatic discovery at any time.
sentences.cn: 在任何时候,原子核裂变都会成为引人注目的发现.

sentences.en: The amount of material produced during fission is insignificant.
sentences.cn: 裂变时产生的物质数量是不够的.

sentences.en: The average fission width can be obtained from a statistical argument.
sentences.cn: 能够从统计理论得到裂变宽度.

sentences.en: The discovery of fission was a seed dropped on fertile ground.
sentences.cn: 裂变的发现犹如种子落入沃土.

sentences.en: The fission of the cell could be inhibited with certain chemicals.
sentences.cn: 细胞的裂变可以通过某些化学药品加以抑制.

sentences.en: The fission products formed are highly radioactive.
sentences.cn: 所生成的裂变产物具有很强的放射性.

sentences.en: The laboratory has designed, tested and evaluated a lightweight, low - yield fission device.
sentences.cn: 该试验室设计, 试验和鉴定了一种轻巧 、 低当量的裂变装置.

sentences.en: The teacher explained the principles of nuclear fission to the class.
sentences.cn: 老师给这个班的学生解释核裂变的原理.

sentences.en: When atoms split, the process is called " fission ".
sentences.cn: 原子分裂时, 其过程被称为 “ 裂变 ”.

words.tran_cn: 可分裂的；可作核裂变的
分裂生殖的；有分裂倾向的
裂缝；裂沟（尤指岩石上的）
[核]裂变；[生物]分裂；分体；[细胞]分裂生殖法

trans.tran_cn: <物>（原子的）分裂，裂变，<生>分裂生殖
trans.tran_en: the division of cells into new cells as a method of reproducing cells
